b.font:
If you are done the exam, click here to checkout. Only checkout once to remove your quiz access.
If you do not checkout you will receive a zero on the exam.

text.p: Implement a function that meets the specifications below.
text.pre: def customsum(t): """ t, a tuple of numbers Returns a function. The function returned should take in one parameter, x, which is a number, and return the sum of x*i over all i, where i is each element in t. """ # Your code here
text.p: For example, print(customsum((1,2,3))(5)) prints 30 because it does 5*1+5*2+5*3.
Paste your entire function, including the definition, in the box below. Do not leave any debugging print statements.

problem.p: Note: An L379 or L397 error: means that your code has an infinite loop for some test case. You will receive a zero for this problem if your code has an infinite loop.

Note on Score Shown: Your code will ultimately be run on our test cases. Getting "Correct"/green check during the exam does not mean you will get full points. The test cases here ensures you do not have a copy/paste error from your IDE.
